metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: This case study demonstrates how to build Internet applications using AppML.
content.html: This case study demonstrates how to build Internet applications using AppML.

content.text: In this case study, AppML runs both in the browser (appml.js) and on the server (appml.php).
content.html: In this case study, AppML runs both in the browser (appml.js) and on the server (appml.php).

content.text: We will use a web server located at https://www.w3schools.com .
content.html: We will use a web server located at https://www.w3schools.com.

content.text: All the files and databases are located on the server.
content.html: All the files and databases are located on the server.

content.text: Later in this tutorial you will learn how to simulate a web server in the browser.
content.html: Later in this tutorial you will learn how to simulate a web server in the browser.

content.text: To demonstrate how to access text files, we have used files like this:
content.html: To demonstrate how to access text files, we have used files like this:

content.code:
Empire Burlesque,Bob Dylan,USA,Columbia,10.90,1985
Hide your heart,Bonnie 
Tyler,UK,CBS Records,9.90,1988
Greatest Hits,Dolly 
Parton,USA,RCA,9.90,1982
Still got the blues,Gary Moore,UK,Virgin 
records,10.20,1990
.
.

Empire Burlesque,Bob Dylan,USA,Columbia,10.90,1985
Hide your heart,Bonnie Tyler,UK,CBS Records,9.90,1988
Greatest Hits,Dolly Parton,USA,RCA,9.90,1982

content.text: To demonstrate how to access XML files, we have used a files like this:
content.html: To demonstrate how to access XML files, we have used a files like this:

content.code:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1"?>
<CATALOG>
<CD>


<TITLE>Empire Burlesque</TITLE>
  <ARTIST>Bob Dylan</ARTIST>


<COUNTRY>USA</COUNTRY>
  <COMPANY>Columbia</COMPANY>


<PRICE>10.90</PRICE>
  <PUBLISHED>1985</PUBLISHED>
</CD>
<CD>


<TITLE>Hide your heart</TITLE>
  <ARTIST>Bonnie Tyler</ARTIST>


<COUNTRY>UK</COUNTRY>
  <COMPANY>CBS Records</COMPANY>


<PRICE>9.90</PRICE>
  <PUBLISHED>1988</PUBLISHED>
</CD>

.
.
content.code_html:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1"?>
<CATALOG>
<CD>
  <TITLE>Empire Burlesque</TITLE>
  <ARTIST>Bob Dylan</ARTIST>
  <COUNTRY>USA</COUNTRY>
  <COMPANY>Columbia</COMPANY>
  <PRICE>10.90</PRICE>
  <PUBLISHED>1985</PUBLISHED>
</CD>

  <COUNTRY>UK</COUNTRY>
  <COMPANY>CBS Records</COMPANY>
  <PRICE>9.90</PRICE>
  <PUBLISHED>1988</PUBLISHED>
</CD>
.
.
